III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Health services; policies and procedures.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4142
Section (1) An institution shall establish and follow written health service
Description policies and procedures addressing all of the following:
(a) Routine and emergency medical, and dental, and behavioral
health care.
1

Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Last week, Youth A broke their foot while playing basketball.
Youth A was taken to the ER, diagnosed with a broken foot, and
placed in a boot. On 8/26/24, youth's boot broke and there has
been no attempt to take Youth A to have it fixed. Youth A has
been in pain, and it is not being addressed.
Investigation This complainant was transferred to DCWL and assigned on
08/28/2024.
Complainant was interviewed via telephone on 08/28/2024, no
additional information was provided.
Foster Care Worker (FCW) was interviewed via telephone on
08/28/2024. FCW reported she was informed of the incident and
did not have any concerns regarding the facility. She saw Youth A
the day after the incident and Youth A did not report any concerns.
Administrator was interviewed at the facility on 08/30/2024. He
reported Youth A was taken immediately to urgent care and was
provided a boot brace that he has been wearing. Administrator
denied the boot brace was broke or that Youth A has not been
wearing it. Youth A has not reported any issues with the boot
brace. Youth A had a follow up appointment today with Henry
Ford orthopedics and x-rayed his foot that showed mild swelling,
but no fracture. They recommended Youth A continue wearing the
boot brace but can start bearing weight if he is able to tolerate
without pain.
Youth A was interviewed at the facility on 08/30/2024. Youth A
was observed wearing a boot brace on his left leg. Youth A
reported he has been at the facility for six months. Youth A
reported he hurt his ankle while playing basketball on 08/20/2024.
He said Staff 1 took him to urgent care, his leg was ex-rayed, and
he was provided with a boot brace. Youth A said he has been
wearing the boot brace and has been using the crutches. Youth A
denied the boot brace is broken but said it has been
uncomfortable to walk around with the boot brace, so the staff
gave him crutches. Youth A said he had a follow up appointment
today and he has to continue wearing the boot brace but can
attempt to walk without the boot brace if he can tolerate the pain.
Youth A said he was given Motrin for pain.
2

Staff 1 was interviewed at the facility on 08/30/2024. Staff 1
reported he transported Youth A to urgent care on 08/20/2024
when he hurt his ankle while playing basketball. Youth A was
provided a boot brace and Motrin for pain. Staff 1 said Youth A
has been wearing the boot brace and he is not aware the boot
brace broke. Staff 1 took Youth A today for a follow up medical
appointment and it was recommended Youth A continue wearing
the boot brace for six weeks, but he can try to walk without it if he
is not in pain. Youth A did not express any concerns to the doctor
regarding the boot brace.
Staff 2 was interviewed at the facility on 08/30/2024. Staff 2
reported she has daily contact with Youth A and he has not
expressed any concerns regarding the boot brace being broke or
being in pain.
Documents Reviewed:
• Incident report dated 08/20/2024, written by Staff 1, Youth
A was playing basketball during recreation time, Youth A
jumped for a rebound landing with his ankle rolling and fell
to the ground. Youth A was transported to the hospital for
evaluation. It was determined Youth A had fractured his
ankle; Youth A was given a boot to walk in and Motrin for
pain.
• Eaton Rapid Medical Center medical report dated
08/20/2024. Youth A’s foot was x-rayed and has a sprained
ankle. Youth A was provided with a boot and Motrin for pain
control.
• Henry Ford Orthopedic Medical Report dated 08/30/2024-
Youth A was examined for an injury to his left ankle
sustained while playing basketball on 08/20/2024. Youth
A’s ankle was x-rayed, mild soft tissue swelling without
fracture or dislocation. Youth A is to continue wearing boot
for the next 6 weeks but can begin bearing weight when he
is able to tolerate without a significant amount of pain.
• Facility’s medical procedure policy reviewed. If medical
emergencies occur youths are to be taking to Eaton Rapids
Medical Center.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance as per interviews conducted
and documentation reviewed, the youth’s boot was not broken, the
youth was taken for a follow up appointment, and his ankle is
healing.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
3

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
